intro: Ruellia mirandana, commonly known as the Philippine skyflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, while its stems are square in cross-section. Ruellia mirandana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
